00048 #define ILLUM_GRIDSIZE 2
00049 #define VECTOR(c, a, b) { \
00050         (c)->x[0] = (float)(a)->x[1] * (b)->x[2] - (float)(a)->x[2] *\
00051                     (b)->x[1]; \
00052         (c)->x[1] = (float)(a)->x[2] * (b)->x[0] - (float)(a)->x[0] *\
00053                     (b)->x[2]; \
00054         (c)->x[2] = (float)(a)->x[0] * (b)->x[1] - (float)(a)->x[1] *\
00055                     (b)->x[0]; }
00056 #define SCALAR(a, b) ( (float)(a)->x[0] * (b)->x[0] + \
00057                       (float)(a)->x[1] * (b)->x[1] + (float)(a)->x[2] *\
00058                       (b)->x[2] )
00059 #define LENGTH(a) sqrt( (float)SCALAR(a, a) )
00060 #define DW_GROUPPREVIEW 0x20
00061 #define DW_XTAGGED 0x10
00062 #define DW_DOORS 0x8
00063 #define DW_THINGS 0x4
00064 #define DW_ALLLINES 0x2
00065 #define DW_CUBES 0x1
00066 #define DW_DEFAULT 0x2f
00067 /* colors */
00068 #define BLACK 0
00069 #define GRAYSCALE 16
00070 #define THINGCOLORS (GRAYSCALE + 1)
00071 #define NUM_OF_THINGS 4
00072 #define DOORCOLORS (THINGCOLORS + NUM_OF_THINGS)
00073 #define NUM_OF_DOORS 5
00074 #define HILIGHTCOLORS (DOORCOLORS + NUM_OF_DOORS)
00075 #define MAXHILIGHT 8
00076 #define USEDCOLORS (HILIGHTCOLORS + MAXHILIGHT + 1)
00077 #define WHITE (USEDCOLORS - 1)

00141 struct track {
00142     struct point x, coords[3];
00143     float length, l_c2, old_twist; /* l_c2=length of tangential vector */
00144     /* old_twist == twist angle of last calculation */
00145     int fixed; /* <=0 is moved from the program, >0 can be moved by the user */
00146     struct track *modify_too; /* for circle, movecorr */
00147 };
00148 struct corridor {
00149     struct list cubes, points;
00150     struct list elements;
00151     int num_pnts, num_cubes; /* in one corridor element */
00152     int *connected, *front_wall;
00153     /* array of size num_cubes*6. In each element j is cube_no*6+wall of
00154        the neighbour cube to cube j/6 wall j%6 saved (-1 if no
00155        neighbour). */
00156     float depth;
00157     struct list tracking; /* the points through which the corridor runs */
00158     struct leveldata *ld;
00159     struct point e[3]; /* default coordsystem on the startside of the corridor
00160                          */
00161     struct node *startcube; /* the cube where the corridor starts */
00162     int startwall;
00163     /* the window stuff: */
00164     struct w_window *win;
00165     struct w_button *b_ok, *b_cancel, *b_ins, *b_del, *b_setend, *b_depth,
00166     *b_stdform;
00167 };
00168 struct listpoint {
00169     struct point p;
00170     struct list c; /* list of cubenodes. no is no of point in cube */
00171     struct node *tagged;
00172 };
00173 struct thing {
00174     /* my stuff */
00175     struct point p[11] NONANSI_FLAG; /* 0 is center, 1..10 are the drawn lines
00176                                        */
00177     struct node *tagged NONANSI_FLAG; /* corresponding node in taglist */
00178     struct node *nc NONANSI_FLAG; /* the cube where the thing is in*/
00179     int color NONANSI_FLAG;
00180     /* descent stuff */
00181     unsigned char type1 NONANSI_FLAG;
00182     unsigned char type2 NONANSI_FLAG;
00183     unsigned char control NONANSI_FLAG;
00184     unsigned char movement NONANSI_FLAG;
00185     unsigned char render NONANSI_FLAG;
00186     unsigned char flags NONANSI_FLAG;
00187     unsigned short cube NONANSI_FLAG;
00188     long pos[3] NONANSI_FLAG;
00189     /* one word to the orientation:
00190        the first 3 components define the normalvector on the right side of
00191        the object.
00192        the second 3 components define the normalvector on the top of the
00193        object.
00194        the third 3 components define the normalvector on the front of the
00195        object.
00196        that means the whole thing has too many parameters. the third vector
00197        is already defined from the first two one. the length of a
00198        normalvector is 0x10000 */
00199     long orientation[9] NONANSI_FLAG;
00200     long size NONANSI_FLAG;
00201     long shield NONANSI_FLAG;
00202     long lastpos[3] NONANSI_FLAG;
00203     unsigned char contain_type1 NONANSI_FLAG;
00204     unsigned char contain_type2 NONANSI_FLAG;
00205     unsigned char contain_count NONANSI_FLAG;
00206 };  /* Descent data length: 79 */

00216     short flags NONANSI_FLAG;
00217 };  /* length: 64 */

00316 struct door {
00317     unsigned long cubenum NONANSI_FLAG;
00318     unsigned long wallnum NONANSI_FLAG;
00319     long hitpoints NONANSI_FLAG;
00320     long linked_wall NONANSI_FLAG;
00321     unsigned char type1, type2 NONANSI_FLAG;
00322     unsigned char state NONANSI_FLAG; /* should be closed=0 */
00323     unsigned char sdoor NONANSI_FLAG;
00324     unsigned char animtxt NONANSI_FLAG;
00325     unsigned char key NONANSI_FLAG;
00326     unsigned char stuff NONANSI_FLAG; /* 0 */
00327     unsigned char cloaking NONANSI_FLAG;
00328     /* my stuff */
00329     unsigned char edoor NONANSI_FLAG; /* open at end? */
00330     unsigned char switchtype NONANSI_FLAG; /* needed that you can change the
00331                                            switchtype from 'No switch' to anything
00332                                               else(the button must be activated)*/
00333     struct node *d NONANSI_FLAG; /* door from other side */
00334     struct node *sd NONANSI_FLAG; /* the sdoor corresponding to this door */
00335     struct list sdoors NONANSI_FLAG; /* doors opening this door */
00336     struct node *c NONANSI_FLAG;
00337     struct wall *w NONANSI_FLAG;
00338     struct point p NONANSI_FLAG;
00339     struct node *tagged NONANSI_FLAG; /* corresponding node in taglist */
00340     short old_txt1 NONANSI_FLAG; /* old texture 1 of the wall */
00341     unsigned char *txt_data NONANSI_FLAG;
00342 };

00348 struct movewall
00349 {
00350     struct node *cube;

00352 };
00353 struct wall {
00354     short int texture1, texture2 NONANSI_FLAG;
00355     /* corners:
00356        in the coord-system of the corners is the bitmap drawn.
00357        (0,0) is the right lower corner of the bitmap, the x-axis
00358        goes along the lower edge of the bitmap in negative direction
00359        (means from lower right edge to lower left edge),
00360        the y-axis from lower right to upper right.
00361        descent fits the texture in the given polygon, so the polygon should
00362        have the same form as the real wall. the normal
00363        coordsystem is scaled 640 times larger than the txture coordsystem.
00364        corners ->  points:
00365                            0 1 2 3 corner
00366        wall 0 (left side):   7 6 2 3
00367        wall 1 (ceiling):     0 4 7 3
00368        wall 2 (right side):  0 1 5 4
00369        wall 3 (floor):       2 6 5 1
00370        wall 4 (front):       4 5 6 7
00371        wall 5 (back):        3 2 1 0
00372      */
00373     struct corner corners[4] NONANSI_FLAG;
00374     /* my stuff */
00375     int txt2_direction NONANSI_FLAG;
00376     struct node *p[4] NONANSI_FLAG;
00377     struct node *tagged[4] NONANSI_FLAG;
00378     int no NONANSI_FLAG;
00379     int locked NONANSI_FLAG;
00380     struct node *ls NONANSI_FLAG; /* lightsource */
00381 };
00382 struct producer {
00383     /* producer produces all roboter with the number of the setted bit */
00384     unsigned long prodwhat[2] NONANSI_FLAG;
00385     unsigned long hitpoints NONANSI_FLAG; /* 0x01f40000=32768000 */
00386     unsigned long interval NONANSI_FLAG; /* 0x00050000=327680 */
00387     unsigned short cubenum NONANSI_FLAG;
00388     unsigned short stuffnum NONANSI_FLAG;
00389     /* stuffnum is not used in Descent */
00390     /* my stuff */
00391     struct node *c NONANSI_FLAG;
00392 };
00393 struct cube {
00394     unsigned char type NONANSI_FLAG;
00395     char prodnum NONANSI_FLAG;
00396     /* value: count every cube with type==4 and write this number in value. */
00397     unsigned char value NONANSI_FLAG;
00398     unsigned char flags NONANSI_FLAG; /* is set by Descent ?? */
00399     unsigned short int light NONANSI_FLAG;
00400     unsigned short int high_light NONANSI_FLAG;
00401     unsigned short int pts[8] NONANSI_FLAG;
00402     unsigned short int nextcubes[6] NONANSI_FLAG;
00403     unsigned char doors[6] NONANSI_FLAG;
00404     /* my stuff */
00405     struct list sdoors NONANSI_FLAG;
00406     struct wall *walls[6] NONANSI_FLAG;
00407     struct node *p[8], *nc[6], *d[6] NONANSI_FLAG;
00408     struct node *cp NONANSI_FLAG; /* producer */
00409     struct node *tagged NONANSI_FLAG; /* corresponding node in taglist */
00410     struct node *tagged_walls[6] NONANSI_FLAG;
00411     struct polygon *polygons[12] NONANSI_FLAG;
00412     unsigned char recalc_polygons[6] NONANSI_FLAG;
00413     struct list things NONANSI_FLAG;
00414     struct list fl_lights NONANSI_FLAG; /* list of f.l. lights that affect this
00415                                         cube */
00416 };

00490 struct infoitem {
00491     enum infotype type; /* type of data */
00492     char *txt; /* description */
00493     enum datastructs infonr; /* to get the corresponding structure */
00494     enum infos tagnr; /* to find the corresponding tag list,
00495                       if tagnr>=in_internal this field is not done with tagged
00496                          objects */
00497     int multifuncnr; /* for selection button=numchildren, for tag button
00498                      =maximum number of tagged options, for texture group:
00499                      0 texture itself
00500                      1-5 texture 1, top,up,down,bottom,name
00501                      6-10 texture 2, top,up,down,bottom,name
00502                      otherwise not relevant */
00503     int offset, length, numchildren; /* offset,length: pos. in structure; */
00504     struct infoitem **children;
00505     int *numinchildren; /* how many entries in children */
00506     /* children=infoitems depending on this infoitem */
00507     unsigned long *itemchildren;
00508     /* itemchildren=array of the numbers belonging to children */
00509     struct objdata *od; /* =NULL if normal field, otherwise the list of objs
00510                         for this field. */
00511     int sidefuncnr; /* call which function */
00512     struct w_button *b; /* the button for this infoitem */
00513 };
00514 /* num_security is the number of extra lighttables at the end and the
00515    beginning of the table, to handle the rounding errors which occur during
00516    the plotting of a texture */
00517 struct viewdata {

00519     /* this is the distance viewpoint-screen */

00521     /* maxdistance which will be drawn */

00523 /* 20 */

00525     /* how fast the points will move */

00527     float protangle NONANSI_FLAG, rotscala NONANSI_FLAG;
00528     /* how fast will we turn */
00529 /* 40 */

00531                                     not needed anymore! */

00533     float bm_stretchfactor NONANSI_FLAG;
00534     float gridlength NONANSI_FLAG, gridscala NONANSI_FLAG;
00535 /* 60 */

00537     /* for connectcubes,connect */

00564     int doubleclick NONANSI_FLAG;

00694 
00695 /* if m is a coordsystem in MATRIXMULT the vectors are in the columns */
00696 #define MATRIXMULT(e, m, v) { int mm_i; \
00697                               for (mm_i = 0; mm_i < 3; mm_i++) { \
00698                                   ( (e)->x[mm_i] ) =\
00699                                       ( (m)[0].x[mm_i] * (v)->x[0] +\
00700                                        (m)[1].x[mm_i] * (v)->x[1] + \
00701                                        (m)[2].x[mm_i] * \
00702                                        (v)->x[2] );} }
00703 /* and in INVMATRIXMULT in the rows */
00704 #define INVMATRIXMULT(e, m, v) { int mm_i; \
00705                                  for (mm_i = 0; mm_i < 3; mm_i++) { \
00706                                      ( (e)->x[mm_i] ) =\
00707                                          ( (m)[mm_i].x[0] * (v)->x[0] +\
00708                                           (m)[mm_i].x[1] * (v)->x[1] + \
00709                                           (m)[mm_i].x[2] * \
00710                                           (v)->x[2] );} }
